description: A decentralized digital currency, without a central bank or single administrator, that can be sent from user to user on the peer-to-peer bitcoin network without the need for intermediaries.
An open source, blockchain-based platform that enables developers to build and deploy decentralized applications (dApps).

A measure used to help investors understand the return of an investment compared to its risk. The ratio is the average return earned in excess of the risk-free rate per unit of volatility or total risk.

A statistical measure of the dispersion of returns for a given security or market index, often measured by using the standard deviation or variance between returns from that same security or market index.
Refers to the potential of losing your investment in the cryptocurrency market, risk can vary significantly across different types of crypto assets.

A system of letters used to uniquely identify a stock or other security on exchanges, in cryptocurrencies, these symbols represent different digital currencies (e.g., BTC for Bitcoin, ETH for Ethereum).
